topic.title: Deet's Place
topic.shortdesc: This topic is about a coffee shop at Virginia Tech in Blacksburg named Deet's Place.

image.alt: A picture of Deet's place that features some of their menu and bakery items on display.

section.title: Atmosphere

image.alt: A picture of the seating area near Deet's place that has a few long tables and smaller ones.

section.p: While there are plenty of tables for seating, this shop is laid out more in a grab-and-go style. The tables are very plain and is lit very brightly.

section.title: Chai Rating
section.p: Their chai is pretty good, but could be better. They do have the option to add syrups, like peppermint, which enhances the flavor.

section.title: Food
section.p: Deet's offers a wide variety of pastries and sandwiches that are warm and delicious. They also offer boba and ice cream.

section.title: Overall Rating
section.p: Deet's Place is a great coffee shop with a lot of room for customization. Their food and pastry selection is great and in a wide variety. There is nothing too special about the seating, but there is plenty of it if you want to take a few moments to enjoy. However, the farm where Deet's sources their milk is across from the Radford Army Ammunition Plant, which dispels thousands of toxins each year. For this reason, I have docked their rating a point. If you visit this shop, which I still recommend you do, I encourage you to choose a milk other than cow's.
